Shooterandproud

Humans are at a very primitive stage. There is still war, violence, and negative emotions. Negative emotions were an evolutionary response to danger, but we haven't evolved far enough to the point of not needing primitive emotions. Violence is a primitive response to keep us alive. To protect us from anything different. If all violence were eliminated, there would be no need for violence in self defense.
 
 I think I can understand creationists. I have learned much about science for a 14 year old boy. I have learned a little bit about quantum mechanics, and its completely mind baffling. The thing that puzzles me most is why an electron is different once its observed. Also that an electron can be in two places at once. I have learned much more, and i haven't even scraped the tip of the iceberg of this stuff. It can be hard to understand. I believe, that people less intelligent who cannot comprehend this, resort to primitive religions and hypothesis to try to explain the universe and whats in it. Eventually, as humans become more intelligent over time, creationism and its hypothesis alike will die.
 
 We humans have still much to evolve. We have many evolutionary flaws thanks to intelligence. One thing I cite, is human's teeth. They are made of a weak material, that can be disintegrated by the very food we eat. This was flawed by intelligence, as we learned to cope. We also have very weak nasal passages, a primitive method of communication, only two limbs, and a very limited brain capacity. In other words, we're just another animal. Nothing special. We have superior intelligence but lesser strength than some animals. I fail to see the logic in creationism. With the knowledge at hand, how can it be possible to believe in something so preposterous? I do not understand it. Please, show me the logic in creationism. Do not attempt to try to point out the flaws in evolution, as that does not make creationism any more true.
 
 Shoot away.

supersport
If you've noticed, I never point out the flaws in evolution to "make Creationism true." I point out the flaws in evolution because ToE is a fraud and there is no sense in anyone believing in it.

I point out the flaws in evolution because ToE is a fraud . . .

 Nonsense. You do only two things: You present "flaws" contained only in your own grossly inaccurate understanding of evolution, and you present what you mistakenly think are flaws in the theory of evolution.
obvious_child

 But that is your goal whether you want to admit it or not. And that is your sole way of defending creationism as you have admitted you cannot argue creationism based on its own merits. Creationism is wrong independent of Evolution. Even if you somehow manage to disprove evolution (along with every science) you still have to even take a single step towards proving Creationism.
 
 
I point out the flaws in evolution because ToE is a fraud and there is no sense in anyone believing in it.

 
 In your strawman of evolution yes. You're obviously using the fraud of fabrication. Create a fabrication of what you want to disprove, disprove the ridiculous fabrication of your own design and then declare the real is false by proxy. 
 
 But why should anyone consider the thoughts of someone who has cited as evidence aganist evolution the commercial creations of villagers who have admitted to essentially fraud? You're never going to get away from that. 
 
 Gullible tourists? More like gulliable creationists.

If you've noticed, I never point out the flaws in evolution to "make Creationism true." I point out the flaws in evolution because ToE is a fraud and there is no sense in anyone believing in it.

 
 A little hole here and there does not make it a fraud. I could do the same thing with the theory of gravity, but i'm sure you believe in that.

A little hole here and there does not make it a fraud. I could do the same thing with the theory of gravity, but i'm sure you believe in that.

Yossarian

No need for anyone to back out of anything, just wake the hell up and realize how ludicrous it is to try and prove or disprove either Evolution or Creationism.
 There's no reason that what's come to be called "intelligent design" isn't the truth. An omnipotent God could certainly have created things at any stage it wished. Why? Who knows?
 
 Shooterandproud wrote: 
The thing that puzzles me most is why an electron is different once its observed.

 
 Because you're observing it. Ipso facto.
 
 
Also that an electron can be in two places at once. I have learned much more, and i haven't even scraped the tip of the iceberg of this stuff. It can be hard to understand. I believe, that people less intelligent who cannot comprehend this, resort to primitive religions and hypothesis to try to explain the universe and whats in it.

 
 That sounds utterly pompous. What does intelligence have to do with one's personal view of the Universe?
 
 
Eventually, as humans become more intelligent over time, creationism and its hypothesis alike will die.
 
 We humans have still much to evolve. We have many evolutionary flaws thanks to intelligence. One thing I cite, is human's teeth. They are made of a weak material, that can be disintegrated by the very food we eat. This was flawed by intelligence, as we learned to cope. We also have very weak nasal passages, a primitive method of communication, only two limbs, and a very limited brain capacity. In other words, we're just another animal. Nothing special.

 
 Forgive me if I'm not understanding you correctly (I'm not so intelligent, see?) According to your logic, as "humans become more intelligent over time" we will also suffer many more "evolutionary flaws thanks to intelligence." I am, to say the least, confused.
 Is intelligence a good thing (as relates to human evolution, growth, whatever you wanna call it) or a bad thing. Human teeth are "weak" because we live so much longer, compared to the fairly recent past when humans rarely lived to their 80's. (Discounting Methuselah, et al., of course :) ) In that instance, "evolution" (strengthened teeth) hasn't caught up with science (better health).
 Too, I find little about our communication ability that I would describe as "primitive". Of course, first we'd have to define "primitive", wouldn't we? If you mean we can't send electrical signals to one another via antennae then I salute you, sir, for stating the obvious. If not, please clarify.
 
 We have four limbs. Count 'em if you think I'm wrong. Though in the interest of fairness I have to point out that none of them is essential for our survival (given a certain amount of societal cooperation, that is).
 
 Lastly, since most neurologist seem to agree that we only utilize roughly 10 percent of our brain, I'd have to say it's capacity could rightly be described as enormous. I have a mere 200G of hard drive space on my computer. If you were to tell me that I actually had, tucked away inside there, another 1800 Gigabytes, I'd be stunned. Then I'd begin downloading massive amounts of porn.
 Just kidding.
